thread.title: Crystal Palace prepare for their Premier League trip to Chelsea this weekend by trolling John Terry
thread.title_full: Crystal Palace prepare for their Premier League trip to Chelsea this weekend by trolling John Terry

author: Jon Moody
title: Crystal Palace prepare for their Premier League trip to Chelsea this weekend by trolling John Terry
text:
Crystal Palace prepare for their Premier League trip to Chelsea this weekend by trolling John Terry The Eagles may well be risking the wrath of the title-chasing Blues come Saturday Share Poor John... (Photo: Scott Heavey) Share     
It's been a (relatively) interesting international break in the world of football, hasn't it? 
We've had the thought-provoking use of video technology in a big game, former world player of the year Kaka acting like a Power Ranger and Jamie Vardy supposedly wearing eyeliner during England's win over Lithuania. 
Sure, there was a some actual football played in the midst of it all, but nobody really cares too much about that during an international break, do they? 
So we're sure you're as excited as we are for the return of the meat and drink of the Premier League this weekend - and we can safely say Crystal Palace are up for it too. "What? You've sold out of the steak pies? N !" (Photo: REUTERS) 
They face the ominous task of travelling to Stamford Bridge this weekend as they face a Chelsea team in cruise control towards their fifth Premier League title. 
Palace themselves are in desperate need of an unlikely win, currently sitting in 16th place in the table on 28 points. "Why did we have to wind up Chelsea now?" (Photo: Getty) 
So their decision to goad the Blues - and captain John Terry - probably isn't too wise a move. 
On the third anniversary of their 1-0 home victory over Chelsea , they've posted highlights of the game on social media - with a particular emphasis on the Terry own goal which gave them all three points. 
That goal proved hugely costly in the title race that season, so reminding them ahead of their next meeting could be asking for trouble. You've got your work cut out for you this weekend, Sam... Like us on Facebook
